## The Adjacent Possible
<hr>

**Confronted with a changing world, organisms can move, adjust, adapt, or die**

<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

<br/>

**In physical space -> <span style="color:blue">move</span>**

<br/>

**In physiological / behavioral space -> <span style="color:blue">adjust</span>**

<br/>

**In genetic / adaptive space -> <span style="color:blue">adapt</span>**

<br/>

**If no adjacent possible -> <span style="color:blue">die</span>**

<br/>

**<span style="color:darkred">Responses are not mutually exclusive</span>**
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:520px; WIDTH:550px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/polar.jpg">

## The adjust response
<hr>

**Adjust: non-genetic shifts in organismal traits in different environments**
    + *phenotypic plasticity*

<br/>

**The adjust response happens at the level of the *individual* and happens within a *single* generation**

<br/>

**What does this mean?!?**

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:380px; LEFT:150px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/plastic.jpg">

## The adjust response
<hr>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 45%;">

**Genotype: inherited genetic information **

<br/>

**Phenotype: observable traits or characteristics**

<br/>

**What is the connection between genotype & phenotype?**

<br/>

**Genotype x Environment = Phenotype**

<br/>

**G x E interactions are the foundation of phenotypic plasiticity**

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:180px; LEFT:500px; WIDTH:650px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/insectsthermal.jpg">

## What is phenotypic plasticity?
<hr>

<div align="center">**When a single genotype can produce multiple phenotypes depending on environmental conditions**</div>

<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Inducible defenses are classic example**
    + animals and plants
    + oftern fast
    + stabilize population dynamics
    + dedicated sensory systems to interpret the environment

<br/>

**Daphnia produce horns and neck teeth in presense of predators**
</div>

## What is phenotypic plasticity?
<hr>
<div align="center">**When a single genotype can produce multiple phenotypes depending on environmental conditions**</div>

<div style="float: left; width: 55%;">

<br/>

* **Plasticity doesn’t only have to be for morphological traits.**

<br/>

* **Physiological, developmental and behavioral traits can also exhibit plasticity**

<br/>

* **Behaviour has long been considered the 'most plastic' phenotypic trait** 
    + quickest response to temporal changes 

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:220px; LEFT:650px; WIDTH:400px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/world.jpg">

## What is phenotypic plasticity?
<hr>
<div align="center">**When a single genotype can produce multiple phenotypes depending on environmental conditions**</div>

* **Developmental plasticity, the ability of an individual to modify its development in response to environmental conditions, might facilitate the evolution of novel traits**

* **How developmental flexibility promotes innovations that persist over evolutionary time remains unclear**


<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:160px; LEFT:675px; WIDTH:333px; HEIGHT:500px" SRC="images/origins.jpg">

## How do you test for phenotypic plasticity?
<hr>

<div align="center">How do you figure out if a trait is controlled by genes, the environment or both?</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:100px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/commongarden.png">

## How do you test for phenotypic plasticity?
<hr>

<div align="center">Effect of genotype only (not phenotypically plastic under these conditions)</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:100px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/commongarden2.png">

## How do you test for phenotypic plasticity?
<hr>

<div align="center">Effect of environment only (YES phenotypically plastic under these conditions)</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:100px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/commongarden3.png">

## How do you test for phenotypic plasticity?
<hr>

<div align="center">Effect of both environment and genotype (genotype by environment interaction)</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:100px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/commongarden4.png">
